events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle on May 19th. Initial report filed with basic details of the accident and parties involved.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident cluster after confirming the involvement of customer's car in a collision with another vehicle.
An experienced claim agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim to ensure timely processing and communication.
Customer received formal acknowledgment of their accident claim, along with contact details for further inquiries.
Request sent for necessary documents including police report, vehicle repair estimates, and driver’s license to proceed with claim review.
Customer successfully submitted all requested documents, including police report and repair bills, enabling the next phase of claim processing.
Claim investigation commenced to verify details of the auto accident, including contacting witnesses and assessing damage reports.
Investigation concluded confirming liability and validating the extent of vehicle damage as reported by the customer.
A fair settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering vehicle repairs and associated costs documented in the investigation.
Customer accepted the settlement proposal and provided positive feedback about the prompt and professional claims service.
Official approval was granted for the settlement amount, preparing the claim for payment issuance.
Payment was promptly issued to the customer’s designated bank account to cover all agreed costs related to the car accident repairs.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following successful payment and customer confirmation of issue resolution.
All documents and correspondence related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
